titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Great 1961 Rose Bowl Hoax Records 1959-2014, bulk 1960-1961
titlestmt.author: Processed by Elisa Piccio.

publicationstmt.p: California Institute of Technology. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid derived from ColdFusion web application and SQLServer relational database. Date of source: Completed June 2015
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid prepared using Finding aid prepared using: "Describing Archives: a Content Standard."

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: California Institute of Technology. Caltech Archives

did.abstract: A small collection of historical photographs and artifacts from the 1961 Rose Bowl hoax pulled off by a group of Caltech undergraduate students, who changed three of the University of Washington card stunts. The documents reveal the full story of how the prank was carried out before a national television audience, during the scheduled half-time at Pasadena's annual Rose Bowl football game.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research. Researchers must apply in writing for access.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Copyright may not have been assigned to the California Institute of Technology Archives. All requests for permission to publish or quote from manuscripts must be submitted in writing to the Caltech Archivist. Permission for publication is given on behalf of the California Institute of Technology Archives as the owner of the physical items and, unless explicitly stated otherwise, is not intended to include or imply permission of the copyright holder, which must also be obtained by the reader.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Great 1961 Rose Bowl Hoax Records, 10279-MS, Caltech Archives, California Institute of Technology.

did.unittitle: Completion list, schedule documents and instruction cards

did.physdesc: Includes 3 CDs and a slide. Negatives are 35 mm.

note.p: Negatives taken by Lee Molho during the making of the card stunt.
